content: The Act may be cited as the "LGBT Elder Americans Act of 2017". Definitions are provided in Section 2. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include status as an LGBT individual. The term 'LGBT' is defined as a lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender individual. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include LGBT individuals as minorities. This change recognizes LGBT individuals as part of the minority group. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include LGBT individuals as minorities, recognizing them as part of the minority group. Additionally, there is a section on the Administration on Aging. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include LGBT individuals as minorities and address their needs within the Administration. The Assistant Secretary is authorized to designate a person responsible for addressing issues affecting LGBT older individuals. The Assistant Secretary is authorized to establish the National Resource Center on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Aging to provide support for LGBT older individuals. The National Resource Center on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Aging aims to educate aging services organizations and LGBT organizations about the special needs of LGBT older individuals, while also providing educational resources to LGBT older individuals and their caregivers. Entities seeking funds must have expertise in working with LGBT individuals and experience in addressing LGBT issues. Entities seeking funds under this subsection must have documented experience in providing training and technical assistance on a national basis or have a formal relationship with an organization that has that experience. To be eligible, an entity must submit an application containing the required information to the Assistant Secretary. The Assistant Secretary will provide necessary resources to the Center annually to effectively carry out its functions, not less than the resources allocated to the National Resource Center on LGBT Aging before the enactment date.
